Home Twinoid The Twinoid Coffee Shop gamesSome Adventure Thing: The Reboot
On may 12, 2016
45424

Some Adventure Thing was a forum RPG created by Dragonice a long time ago. It eventually died down after 4 full 1000-post threads, but seeing that the forum currently doesn't have any RPG with a full level-up/battle system (Soul Fray is inactive) and Dragonice suddenly reappeared, we've decided to restart it with improved consistency/balance/story line.

In the world of Somewhere (yes that's the world's name because I'm bad at names), there are 5 known civilized races: Human, Elf, Dwarf, Goblin, Dragonkin. You're a new adventurer of one of these races. You don't really have any aim (like most RPG adventurers); you just want to explore and get stronger, but of course you can make one for yourself.

All info of this game is/will be put into this Google Spreadsheet. You can pick one of the race and an available starting class for the race.

After that, pick a name, fill in the character sheet and you're free to go!

====================================

Sample character sheet (use suitable icons that you unlocked):

Ceril Lightshot

Location: (-3, -6)

Race: Dragonkin
Class: Tamer
4/4
7/7
Lv. 1
0/100
0
10 Arions

Inventory
1. [] Pocket penknife (1 ) [Equipped]
2. []
3. []
4. []
5. []
6. []
7. []

Spells
1. [1] Charm (converts enemy max level 1) -3

Passive traits
None

Some explanations:
Location: you start at the capital of your race. The map is on the Spreadsheet.

= HP: base is 5, -1 because Dragonkin
= MP: base is 5, +2 because Dragonkin
= level: you start at level 1, and you level up whenever you gain enough
= experience, you need 100XP to level up from 1 to 2, and more at higher levels
= skill points, you gain one each level up. You can use one to gain a new skill from your class or level up an existing skill.
= Arions, the currency of Somewhere. You'll need it. You start with 10 Arions.

You start with a (pathetic) pocket penknife in your inventory. The icon shows that it's a weapon. You most likely won't have this icon, so use another instead. You can only equip two 1-hand weapons or one 2-hand weapon at the same time (obviously). Weapons are 1h unless otherwise stated. Inventory has 7 slots unless you're a goblin, then you get 8.

Skills consist of spells and passive traits. You start with a level 1 skill from your class. You can pick any one of them, but I'd prefer a spell or otherwise your MP has no use. The number inside the square brackets is the level of the skill.

====================================

You can perform one of the three actions each day (according to server time): Travel, Scavenge or Rest.

You can choose to travel to one of the 8 adjacent grids (including diagonally). There's a very high chance you'll encounter an enemy while you travel. If you survive the fight, you'll successfully arrive at your chosen destination, which may contain Arions or items laying around, an NPC, and/or a dungeon entrance, etc.

If you choose to scavenge, it's guaranteed you'll get an item out of the location's scavenge table, but you lose the chance of gaining .

If you choose to rest, you regain HP and MP up to half of their max value. (rounded down)

If you die for whatever reason, you respawn at your race's starting point with your reset to 0. (Level is unaffected)

====================================

Player interactions:

When two players meet at the same location, they can choose to travel together. The encounters will be more difficult, the will be evenly shared, and the loot will be distributed by RNG.

One player can also challenge the other to a duel (with a stake or not). Both players will begin a battle fully healed, and everything will be restored to the pre-duel state after the duel (except the staked items). No consumables can be used in a duel. Both players must agree for the duel to start.

If you don't want to issue a challenge, you can also choose to assault the other player. In this case, only the assaulted will be fully healed, and deaths will result in losing and being sent back to respawn point. The winner can take half of the and one item that the loser has. All consumables are allowed.

====================================

If you still understand everything so far, feel free to join this RPG by posting your character sheet below!

If you don't, you can still ask.

On may 12, 2016
Kelixbro34

On may 12, 2016
45424

First human!

Yeah, you can pick any of the Warrior skill.

You have one action per day, which may contain a battle.

In a battle, you, your followers, and your enemies take turn attacking. The order is determined by RNG at the start of the battle, and some skills may affect it.

In each turn, you can choose to use any number of non-turn-taking spells, one consumables, and either attack with your weapon/fist or use a turn-taking spell like Dynamics.

A battle ends if either side of the party flees. You can flee (along with your followers) any time in your turn, but you won't get any /loot. You also won't get to the destination if you're travelling, effectively wasting your action of the day.

It's better to learn about the battle system in a battle rather than words, so I'll wait till there's a battle.

1. Wild Strike 3-5/4-7/5-9 spell damage of a random element in fire/water/wood/electric. --


Passive traits
Arcane Aura: +50% max MP. All allied units +0.5/1/1.5 MP per turn. (Passive)

Elemental Master: Adds the following effects to Wild Strike:
Fire: hits 1/2/3 extra random enemies
Water: 10%/20%/30% chance to freeze target for 1 turn
Wood: Target -10%/20%/30% accuracy for 1 turn
Electric: 10%/20%/30% chance to paralyze target for 2 turns

45424

You: 2/5
Wolf: 4/4 1-2

Wolf's order of attack: Tails (tails = after rat, heads = before)

The rat attacks. Target is random (you can't just hide behind your wolf )

Target roll: Heads (tails = you, heads = wolf)
Accuracy roll: Tails

On may 14, 2016
[8886413]

No, the spell damage is variable (use that RPS result) and the mana cost is the level one cost, which is the one furthest to the left (three). Also, you need to roll a d4 to see what element it will be.
So, in summary:
Mana cost: 3
Damage: 3
Element: roll d4
Element doesn't really matter in this case because you'll kill it, but just for future battles.
On may 14, 2016
darksurvivor07

Oh, got it. Will keep in mind for future battles when I don't just 1 hit something.

On may 15, 2016
[8886413]

Uh, technically tails for a bronze knife does 1 damage and heads does 2, as a higher values does more damage, and lower accuracy values are better. Just saying...

On may 15, 2016
45424

Brand new action: Rest

If you choose to rest for the day, you can restore HP and MP until they're at half of their value, at the cost of not being able to do anything else.

There, health problem partially solved.
On may 15, 2016
[8886413]
45424Brand new action: Rest

If you choose to rest for the day, you can restore HP and MP until they're at half of their value, at the cost of not being able to do anything else.

There, health problem partially solved.

I do have plenty of HP, but I like the comfort of HP potion. Anyway, that's a nice solution.

On may 18, 2016
45424
Zazyman32Troll 1 loot: 90
Troll 2 loot: 66
Quick search: 30
Is there a thing for having a spade and being a goblin roll? I'm not quite sure

You level up and gain one skill point! You can spend it on any of the two skills you didn't learn (level 2 skills can only be learned at level 3+; level 3 skills can only be learned at level 5+). Or you can save it for later (won't have any use for now).

You quickly loot the trolls before their parents come find them (actually never; trolls aren't good parents). You find absolutely nothing though. Makes sense, since baby trolls are known to eat anything they can swallow.

You set up your camp as far as possible from the corpses. You find an MP potion on the way!
On may 18, 2016
[8886413]
45424

You level up and gain one :drpg_lvlup_10: skill point! You can spend it on any of the two skills you didn't learn (level 2 skills can only be learned at level 3+; level 3 skills can only be learned at level 5+). Or you can save it for later (won't have any use for now).

You quickly loot the trolls before their parents come find them (actually never; trolls aren't good parents). You find absolutely nothing though. Makes sense, since baby trolls are known to eat anything they can swallow.

You set up your camp as far as possible from the corpses. You find an :_hotel.en_lab_1: MP potion on the way!

Not an HP potion? *sigh* :p.

Anything else I can spend the skill point on BTW? And by level 2 skills, do you mean I can't level up dynamics?

45424

You can't level Dynamics until you're level 3. Go try out the turret or the shield instead.

You can buy level 0 skills at some places. You'll need skill points to level those up. There's also another way to get skills, but I won't spoil it for now.
On may 18, 2016
[8886413]
45424

You can't level Dynamics until you're level 3. Go try out the turret or the shield instead.

You can buy level 0 skills at some places. You'll need skill points to level those up. There's also another way to get skills, but I won't spoil it for now.

In that case, I'll take auto turret, Reflective shield doesn't interest me at all since my wolf would take hits, and since I only get hit 25% of the time, its not *that* beneficial. Auto turret looks cool though, since it doesn't take a turn and that 100% accuracy is pretty good.

On may 20, 2016
45424

There's no auto-scavenge option. This game encourages activity. Also, the game engine cannot handle the case when you pick up an item while your bag is full.

The only auto-action is Rest.

45424
Kelixbro34

Spider 3 dies,

30EXP

Loot the three
62 5 83

Search the zone
7

You get a piece of spider silk (used to make mage armour, and is quite valuable by itself) and an iron sword (2 ).

The villagers tell you that they're recruiting brave warriors to fend off some invading trolls. (quest line)

You also find a shop (yay) that sells more advanced items, a blacksmith who will make metal weapons and armours if you provide him materials ("sorry we used up all our metal against trolls" ) and a crafter who can make ranger and mage weapons and armours, again if you provide her materials.

So, Ant 8, ant 1, Zaxaz, ant 3, ant 4, ant 6, wolf, ant 2, ant 7, ant 5
The ants will be referred to in order, not as above, so,

Ant 1, ant 2, Zaxaz, ant 3, ant 4, ant 5, wolf, ant 6, ant 7, ant 8

First is choice (heads = wolf) second is accuracy)
Ant 1: Tails Tails
Ant 2: Tails Heads
Zaxaz (ant 3 and then down): Penknife Tails
Bronze knife: Heads (only rolling Acc)
Ant 3: Tails Tails
Ant 4: Tails Tails
Ant 5: Heads Heads
Wolf (ant 6 then down): Tails (only rolling Acc)
Ant 6: Heads Heads
Ant 7: Heads Tails
Ant 8: Heads Tails

-New turn-

Ant 1: Tails Heads
Ant 2: Heads Heads
Zaxaz (ant 3 and then down): Penknife Heads
Bronze knife: Heads (only rolling Acc)
Ant 3: Heads Heads
Ant 4: Tails Heads
Ant 5: Tails Tails

On may 26, 2016
[8886413]
MinerXShiney! Anyways, slowly getting there. Dps is the answer I guess...

*activates nerd voice* Well, technically this a turn based game so it's damage per turn, therefore dpt not dps.

Ahem, anyway... Yeah, more damage means you'll be killing enemies faster which means you take less damage. With my set up allowing me to not only deal lots of damage (7 at most currently) but I'm also able to spread it out and like I did on my last turn I managed to kill 4 enemies in the same turn. Dynamics also helps because not only does it deal damage itself, but it also mitigates the amount of damage that comes my way, meaning I have to heal less. But I'm rambling now, and thanks for fun game 45!

Can't wait to find out about the ultimate skills and the other ways to spend skill points...

MinerX
MinerXAlso, am I mistaken or does a character gain 1 hp and MP when he levels up?
TailsTails 1-2 damage Heads poison
TailsHeads 1-2 damage Tails poison
Dundric lasers spider 1's face off! 1 4-7 damage

1 damage from poison spider1
2 damage from spider 2, also, does of l poison proc on heads or tails? Either Way, Dundric might be dead unless his new hp is 5/7 (level up)
On may 29, 2016
[8886413]
MinerX1 damage from poison spider1
2 damage from spider 2, also, does of l poison proc on heads or tails? Either Way, Dundric might be dead unless his new hp is 5/7 (level up)

yeah, you gain 1 HP and 1 MP from level up, along with your max HP/MP increase.
You should define which one it triggers on, but generally for %-based things, the lower the better so it should trigger on the lower value (tails)
On may 29, 2016
45424
MinerX1 damage from poison spider1
2 damage from spider 2, also, does of l poison proc on heads or tails? Either Way, Dundric might be dead unless his new hp is 5/7 (level up)

Your HP was 5/7 before the battle. You took 3 damage and was poisoned, so you took an extra 1 damage just after your turn. Now you should have 1HP unless you've drunk a potion.

45424

I sell the (severely broken) leather body for 2 and buy another for 10 . I then ask the shop owner if there's any crafter around.

Shop ownerThere's a crafter at each of the 4 outposts around the city. (marked on the map) They can make any non-metal armours and weapons for a small fee if you have the materials! They can also mend your broken armours.

I ask her about the blue orb.

Shop ownerOh I've seen this before! Some human mages came here carrying a bunch of differently coloured orbs that looked like this, and bought a huge bunch MP potions from me. I think they came from the Mage Tower at (5, -5)?

- Can attack and cast

On june 2, 2016
45424

You'll have to pick a weapon attack to be replace by the cleave. Then that attack is replaced by a ton of damage and accuracy rolls, as if you attack each of the targets once. Apply the 50% multiplier to the damage against the non-main targets.

So in average you should be able to wipe out half of the ants if you cleave with your iron sword.
On june 2, 2016
Kelixbro34

So like, example:

Eric uses Cleave on all targets!

(Do I use the ht acc flip and d100 dmg roll?)

Like this?
Tails62

Or is the process rendered differently?
On june 2, 2016
45424
Kelixbro34

So like, example:

Eric uses Cleave on all targets!

(Do I use the ht acc flip and d100 dmg roll?)

Like this?
Tails62

Or is the process rendered differently?

Just the attack rolls as usual, repeated a lot of times.
Since iron sword has constant damage value, you only need the accuracy rolls.
On june 2, 2016
Kelixbro34
45424Just the attack rolls as usual, repeated a lot of times.
Since iron sword has constant damage value, you only need the accuracy rolls.

Ooooooooohhh but attack damage is increased to 100% aka the highest damage rate of a weapon right?

Like I just Tails once and it's maximum damage huh?
On june 2, 2016
45424

I'll give an example. Let's say you're fighting against 3 enemies, and you have a weapon that has 4-7 damage, and another with 3-5 damage. You decide to use your level 2 Great Cleave against enemy 1 with your first weapon.

Your cleave attack:
Against enemy 1: Accuracy: Tails Damage: 3 (result of d4)
Against enemy 2: Accuracy: Heads Damage: 4 (result of d4)
Against enemy 3: Accuracy: Tails Damage: 2 (result of d4)

Your second weapon:
Target: enemy 1 Accuracy: Heads Damage: Scissors

You would've dealt 6 damage to enemy 1, and 2 damage (5 * 50% rounded down) to enemy 3.
On june 2, 2016
45424

Meanwhile, Ceril goes south again. 54
On june 2, 2016
Kelixbro34
45424

I'll give an example. Let's say you're fighting against 3 enemies, and you have a weapon that has 4-7 damage, and another with 3-5 damage. You decide to use your level 2 Great Cleave against enemy 1 with your first weapon.

Your cleave attack:
Against enemy 1: Accuracy: Tails Damage: 3 (result of d4)
Against enemy 2: Accuracy: Heads Damage: 4 (result of d4)
Against enemy 3: Accuracy: Tails Damage: 2 (result of d4)

Your second weapon:
Target: enemy 1 Accuracy: Heads Damage: Scissors

You would've dealt 6 damage to enemy 1, and 2 damage (5 * 50% rounded down) to enemy 3.

Oh right!

So if I get...
6 damage on first person it goes up to 7
Then for second person if it was like 5 for eg, it'll round down 50%
And for the third it'll round down to...40% huh? I think I got the hang of it now, thanks

45424

The spiders drop nothing. Again.

At least I found an MP potion to replace the used one!

At the outpost, I ask the crafter to repair my armour and make a pair of boots out of the spider silk. She nods and after a couple of hours, gives me a fully-repaired leather body and a pair of spider silk boots! (1 20 ), charging me 2 and 2 respectively.

I then sell the HP potion and Pocket penknife and buy an iron crossbow (ammo in this game is magically generated) from the shop.

Elves prefer ranged combat, so they generally sell ranged weapons and non-metal armours.
